subject: Re: mic adapter? ~ Margaret
author: itcdeadpeople
full_text:
You're welcome, Laura.  No need for embarrassment.  There's OODLES of stuff I don't 
know and have to ask others for technical help, so it's nice to be able to help someone 
else once in a while.  

LOL - The running joke with my husband is when I start asking for the "thingymajigger" 
that goes to the "doohicky" when I don't know the proper names of items.  Fortunately for 
me, he can usually figure out what I'm meaning! 

Absolutely, you are gonna learn and get it all together correctly.  :-)

Margaret

>

> Laura

> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@> 
> wrote:
> >
> > Hi Laura.  I use Audacity to record box/radio sweep sessions, but I 
> find that using it for 
> > 'traditional' EVP purposes hasn't worked for me.  When I do 
> traditional EVP sessions, I use 
> > any of my digital recorders (which is where the EVP seem to be 
> formed best, not when 
> > using the computer) then play the file from my recorder into my 
> computer, so I can better 
> > review the content of the session as well as edit, save, share, 
> etc.  So yes, you still need a 
> > patch cable.  :-)
> > 
> > I think the confusion may have been when you told them at Radio 
> Shack that you wanted 
> > to connect your mic of the recorder to the mic of your computer??  
> What you want to do is 
> > connect the EAR/HEADPHONE to the computer.  So, instead of 
> listening through the 
> > speaker of the recorder, or plugging in headphones and listening 
> with your ears, you are 
> > going to play the file and let your computer hear it through the 
> cable.  Hope that makes 
> > sense.
> > 
> > Just press the record button on Audacity, then press the play 
> button on your recorder, and 
> > it will start recording in the computer.  Then save your session.  
> After that you can edit, 
> > isolate areas, export WAV files, etc.  If you want to be able to 
> export MP3 format, you have 
> > to download/install the LAME add-on for Audacity.  
> > 
> > Margaret
>
